verse: After these things, during the rule of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra came up [Ezra’s coming is not actually stated until v. 6] from Babylon [if this refers to Artaxerxes I, then chapter seven takes place around 458 bc, about fifty-eight years after chapter six, but some date the events differently] as the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the ·high [chief] priest.

This Ezra came ·to Jerusalem [up] from Babylon. He was a ·teacher and knew well [scribe skilled/well versed in] the ·Teachings [Law; Torah] of Moses that had been given by the Lord, the God of Israel. Ezra received everything he asked for from the king, because the [hand of the] Lord his God was ·helping [on] him.
In the seventh year of King Artaxerxes more ·Israelites [sons/people of Israel] came to Jerusalem. Among them were priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, and Temple servants.
Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the fifth month of Artaxerxes’ seventh year as king.

Ezra had left Babylon on the first day of the first month [April 8], and he arrived in Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month [August 4], because [the good/gracious hand of] God was ·helping [on] him.

Ezra had ·worked hard [dedicated/devoted himself; set his heart] to ·know [study] and ·obey [practice; do; observe] the ·Teachings [Law; Torah] of the Lord and to teach his rules and commands to the Israelites.

King Artaxerxes had given a ·letter [document] to Ezra, a priest and ·teacher [scribe] ·who taught about [learned in] the commands and laws the Lord gave Israel. This is a copy of the ·letter [document]:

·Praise [Blessed be] the Lord, the God of our ·ancestors [fathers]. He ·caused the king [put in the king’s heart] to want to ·honor [beautify; adorn; glorify] the ·Temple [house] of the Lord in Jerusalem.

The Lord has shown me [Ezra], his ·love [loyalty] ·in the presence of [before] the king, ·those who advise the king [his counselors/advisers], and ·the royal officers [his mighty nobles/officials]. Because the Lord my God was helping me, I ·had courage [was strengthened], and I gathered the ·leaders [heads of the fathers] of Israel to ·return [go up] with me.
